meaningMnemonic: The <radical>grain</radical> you cut off a <radical>tree</radical> with a <radical>knife</radical> is a <kanji>pear</kanji>. I don't know if you've ever seen Asian pears, but they're pretty big and sturdy. You can't just pick them off of the tree, you need the help of a knife. That's why this is a pear, and not an apple or peach or something else.
readingMnemonic: As you cut the <kanji>pear</kanji>s down, you can't help but <reading>gnash</reading> (なし) your teeth. You want to eat these pears right now. You gnash and grind and wait though, because you want to have them all down before you start the feast.
